item.title: Limits
item.description: Rate LimitsThe global rate limit for Cloudflare’s API is 1200 requests per five minutes. If you exceed this, all API calls for the next five minutes will be blocked, receiving a HTTP 429 response. Some specific API calls have their own limits and are documented separately, such as the Cache Purge APIs: https://api.cloudflare.com/#zone-purge-files-by-url External link icon Open external link https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/operations/zone-purge-files-by-cache-tags,-host-or-prefix Enterprise customers may contact Cloudflare Support External link icon Open external link to raise the limit of a higher value if needed.

item.title: API token permissions
item.description: API token permissionsPermissions are segmented into three categories based on resource: Zone permissions Account permissions User permissions Each category contains permission groups related to those resources. DNS permissions belong to the Zone category, while Billing permissions belong to the Account category. Below is a list of the available token permissions. To obtain an updated list of token permissions, including the permission ID and the scope of each permission, use the List permission groups endpoint.
